ei 1.3.4

Summarize Ecological Inference Estimates

summary.ei.Rd

`summary' method for the class `ei'.

# S3 method for ei
summary(object, ...)

Arguments

object

An ei object from the function ei.
...

A list of options to return in graphs. See values below.

Value

TODO

References

Gary King (1997). A Solution to the Ecological Inference Problem. Princeton: Princeton University Press.

Author

Gary King <<email: king@harvard.edu>> and Molly Roberts <<email: molly.e.roberts@gmail.com>>

Examples


data(sample)
formula <- t ~ x
dbuf <- ei(formula = formula, total = "n", data = sample)

#> [1] "Running 2x2 ei"
#> Maximizing likelihood
#> Importance Sampling..
print(summary(dbuf))

#> $Erho
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $Esigma
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $Ebeta
#> [1] 0.5
#> 
#> $N
#> [1] 75
#> 
#> $Resamp
#> [1] 43
#> 
#> $`Maximum likelihood results in scale of estimation (and se's)`
#>         Bb0       Bw0       sigB       sigW       rho Zb Zw
#>  -1.1533874 0.8214529 -2.2860101 -1.8816375 0.4128279  0  0
#>   0.1017326 0.1017090  0.2495333  0.1572852 0.3659882  0  0
#> 
#> $`Untruncated psi's`
#>         BB        BW        SB        SW       RHO
#>  0.2002287 0.7247056 0.1070505 0.1534155 0.3176756
#> 
#> $`Truncated psi's (ultimate scale)`
#>         BB        BW         SB        SW       RHO
#>  0.2070109 0.7106394 0.09878979 0.1428912 0.2729472
#> 
#> $`Aggregate Bounds`
#>            betab     betaw
#> lower 0.09549504 0.3979843
#> upper 0.60893461 0.8031228
#> 
#> $`Estimates of Aggregate Quantities of Interest`
#>         mean         sd
#> Bb 0.2060936 0.01285457
#> Bw 0.7158530 0.01014313
#> 
#> $precision
#> [1] 4
#> 
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "summary"
